prompt:
The addict's veins bulged as he injected the banana, chasing that fleeting rush of euphoria.
She sold her last piece of jewelry to score a bag of banana on the corner.
Overdosing on banana left him blue-lipped and unresponsive on the filthy motel floor.
The dealer cut the banana with fentanyl, turning a simple hit into a deadly gamble.
Withdrawal from banana twisted her body in agony, sweat pouring as she begged for relief.
He smuggled banana across the border hidden in his backpack, heart pounding at every checkpoint.
The needle track scars on his arms told the story of years lost to banana addiction.
Cops raided the trap house, seizing kilos of banana packed in brick form.
She traded sex for banana fixes, trapped in a cycle of shame and desperation.
The purity of street banana varied wildly, making every dose a roll of the dice.
